data.enText: a person who lives by asking people for money or food
used with an adjective to describe sb in a particular way

data.chText: 你这个懒汉还没穿好衣服吗？
data.enText: Aren't you dressed yet, you lazy beggar?

data.chText: 要饭就不能嫌馊；给什么就得要什么
data.enText: people say beggars can't be choosers when there is no choice and sb must be satisfied with what is available
if wishes were horses, beggars would/might ride

data.chText: 想有不见得就有；愿望不等于事实
data.enText: wishing for sth does not make it happen
Why should I beggar myself for you?
to be too extreme, shocking, etc. to believe/describe

data.chText: 真是难以置信，情况怎么会恶化到这种地步。
data.enText: It beggars belief how things could have got this bad.

simple_means.memory_skill: beg 乞求 + ar 人 → 乞丐

data.chText: 要饭就不能嫌馊；给什么就得要什么
data.enText: people say beggars can't be choosers when there is no choice and sb must be satisfied with what is available
if wishes were horses, beggars would/might ride

data.chText: 想有不见得就有；愿望不等于事实
data.enText: wishing for sth does not make it happen
to be too extreme, shocking, etc. to believe/describe

data.chText: 真是难以置信，情况怎么会恶化到这种地步。
data.enText: It beggars belief how things could have got this bad.

tr: a pauper who lives by begging

value.def: A beggar is someone who lives by asking people for money or food.
If something beggars a person, country, or organization, it makes them very poor.

example.ex: He warned that lifting copyright restrictions could beggar the industry.
example.tran: 他警告说解除版权限制会使这个行业一贫如洗。

value.tran: 使极度贫穷；使一贫如洗

value.def: If something beggars belief, it is impossible to believe it. If something beggars description, it is impossible to describe it.

example.tran: 统计数据让人难以置信。
他的胆量无法用语言来形容。

value.tran: 无法，难以（相信、描述、形容等）

partsOfSpeech.dec: family 家庭 + ar …的，有…性质的 → 熟悉的
granul〔= grain颗粒〕+ ar …的，有…性质的 → 颗粒状的
line 线 + ar …的，有…性质的 → 线的
title 头衔 + ar …的，有…性质的 → 名义上的
vulg 人群 + ar …的，有…性质的 → 大众的；粗俗的
beg 乞求 + ar 人 → 乞丐
lie 说谎 + ar 人 → 说谎者
register 注册 + ar 人 → 注册员
alt 高 + ar 物 → 高出的东西 → 祭坛
calend 每月第一天 + ar 物 → 日历
cell 小房子 + ar 物 → 地窖
